avalancheActivity.highlights: The snowpack is considered pretty stabel after the thaw last weekend.

snowpackStructure.highlights: The snow settled well after thaw and rain last weekend and the snowpack is considered pretty stable.

travelAdvisory.comment: It thawed in all Iceland last weekend. It has been warm during the day and slush avalanches could occur in steep waterways. Avalanche danger is widely decreasing but some wet avalanches could occur.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Avalanche danger is slowly decreasing but still chances of wet avalanches in many places. There is still some layering in the snowpack in the north.

weatherForecast.highlights: Norðlæg eða breytileg átt og þurrt. Milt veður en næturfrost.

avalancheActivity.comment: Quite a few avalanches occurred in the thaw over the weekend. A large slush avalanche occurred in Seyðisfjörður on the evening of April 21st and another one occurred in Hestfjörður on the evening of April 22nd.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Saturday was warm with rain and a few avalanches occurred. Wet avalanches could occur while the snowpack adjusts.

snowpackStructure.highlights: The snowpack is most likely becoming rather homogenous after frost and thaw cycles. A snowpit made in Steiniðjugil on April 23 showed a rather homogenous and isothermal snow. Some wet sluffs could occur in the next few days and some layering could still be in the snowpack at high elevations. Two large slush avalanches have occurred after it stopped raining, in steep waterways. Danger of slush avalanches is expected to decrease as temperatures drop.

travelAdvisory.comment: It thawed in all Iceland last weekend. It has been warm during the day and slush avalanches could occur in steep waterways. Avalanche danger is widely decreasing but some wet avalanches could occur.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Avalanche danger is slowly decreasing but still chances of wet avalanches in many places. There is still some layering in the snowpack in the north.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hæg breytileg átt næstu daga og léttskýjað. Hiti yfir frostmarki yfir daginn en næturfrost víða. Útlit fyrir norðaustlæga átt á laugardag með kólnandi veðri.

avalancheActivity.comment: Wide slab avalanche fell in Kotafjall in Svarfaðardalur, another smaller one in Skíðadalur on 20.04, another size 2 wet loose avalanche released in Þrastarstaðaskál in Höfðaströnd. Large slab avalanche fell in NW-winds on 15th April in Fljót.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow has subsided somewhat in the thaw last weekend and snow has become wet and but not in highest mountains. Snow is affected by diurnal temperature fluctuations and solar radiation. Considerable snow still in high elevations and some slabs persist there.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Thaw during last weekend and snow has subsided and stiffened somewhat, but considerable snow is high in mountains and slabs can persist in high elevations. A snowpit in Burstabrekkudalur on Monday gave CT11RP but ECTX, a weak layer by an ice layer on top of old firn persists. Weak layer can persist in high elevations. Warm temperatures during the day and solar radiation affects the top layers of the snow and chance of wet avalanches.

travelAdvisory.comment: It thawed in all Iceland last weekend. It has been warm during the day and slush avalanches could occur in steep waterways. Avalanche danger is widely decreasing but some wet avalanches could occur.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Avalanche danger is slowly decreasing but still chances of wet avalanches in many places. There is still some layering in the snowpack in the north.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hæglætis veður næstu daga og kólnandi en dægursveiflur í hitastigi. Lítilsháttar él möguleg á laugardag.

avalancheActivity.comment: Avalanches occurred in many places in the thaw last weekend.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Last weekend was warm and a few avalanches were seen in the area. A skier triggered a small avalanche in Oddsskarð on Sunday. Small avalanches could continue to occur in the next few days. A lot of snow is still in the mountains and inland, and layers could still be present.

snowpackStructure.highlights: A lot of snow is still in the mountains but some snow has melted in recent days. Quite a few avalanches occurred in the area during the thaw. One small avalanches was triggered by a skier in Oddsskarð on Sunday. The snowpack is expected to become stronger in the freeze-thaw cycles, but some sluffs could occur. Layered wind slabs were present and some layering could still be in the snowpack. Cornices are widely on S-W aspects.

travelAdvisory.comment: It thawed in all Iceland last weekend. It has been warm during the day and slush avalanches could occur in steep waterways. Avalanche danger is widely decreasing but some wet avalanches could occur.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Avalanche danger is slowly decreasing but still chances of wet avalanches in many places. There is still some layering in the snowpack in the north.

weatherForecast.highlights: Norðlægar áttir næstu daga og útlit fyrir snjókomu á laugardag. Kólnar á fimmtudag.
